ABOUT_PAGE.TITLE: About the app
ABOUT_PAGE.TEXT1: Renal Health is an application designed to broaden the knowledge of the overall population about kidney disease and to support patients with chronic kidney disease regarding the production of knowledge, as well as the continuous monitoring of their health status and treatment.
ABOUT_PAGE.TEXT2: The effectiveness of the Renal Health app depends on the CORRECT data entry and patient compliance to instructions. Even when using the Renal Health app, the patient should continue to follow the instructions of healthcare professionals.

ABOUT_KIDNEY_TRANSPLANTATION.TITLE: Kidney transplant

LABEL2.PARAGRAPH_1: It is a surgery performed to place a healthy kidney in a patient with advanced chronic kidney disease. This new kidney will perform the functions that diseased kidneys can no longer maintain.
LABEL2.PARAGRAPH_2: After the transplantation indication, the patient undergoes a clinical evaluation that includes several examinations.

LABEL4.PARAGRAPH_1: A kidney transplantation can be performed from living donors or deceased donors.
LABEL4.PARAGRAPH_2: Kidney donation between living persons is permitted by Brazilian law up to the fourth degree of kinship and between spouses, provided that the donor is not a minor, has a compatible blood group and appropriate compatibility tests.
LABEL4.PARAGRAPH_3: Deceased donors are individuals that are brain dead and who, after the family’s authorization, have their organs donated.

ABOUT_KIDNEY_TRANSPLANTATION.LABEL6: Patients who have been evaluated and included in a list to undergo a transplant with a deceased donor can be called at any time, so it is very important to keep updated address and telephone numbers and to be in good health for the surgery. The waiting period varies and depends on the availability of a donor who is accepted by the transplant team and who is compatible with the recipient.

LABEL8.PARAGRAPH_1: The transplanted kidney functions like a normal kidney.
LABEL8.PARAGRAPH_4: There is no need for dialysis anymore, so the patient has more free time.

LABEL10.PARAGRAPH_1: It is necessary to undergo surgery.
LABEL10.PARAGRAPH_2: A compatible donor must be available.
LABEL10.PARAGRAPH_3: There is a possibility that the body rejects the new kidney.
LABEL10.PARAGRAPH_4: It is necessary to attend regular appointments and use medications for the rest of one’s life.

PARAGRAPH_1.TITLE: What is crossmatch?
PARAGRAPH_1.TEXT: It is the test in which the recipient’s and donor’s blood are mixed to see if there is a possibility of rejection in the first hours after transplantation. If it is positive, the transplant cannot be performed because the chance of immediate rejection is almost 100%.

PARAGRAPH_2.TITLE: What does rejection mean?
PARAGRAPH_2.TEXT: Rejection is the term used to describe the body's reaction to the new kidney. Some patients may exhibit it during the first or second week after transplantation. There are several ways to prevent and treat rejection, and most often it is resolved.

PARAGRAPH_3.TITLE: Why is it necessary to take special medications after the transplantation?
PARAGRAPH_3.TEXT: The body has a very complex system (immune system) that reacts against foreign organs. Because the transplanted kidney is recognized as “foreign”, the body will react against it and try to destroy it. Immunosuppressive drugs slow down this reaction.

TEXT1.PARAGRAPH_1: After the fistula is created, the arm should be kept elevated and very tight bandages should be avoided. The fistula flow, called thrill, should be checked daily.
TEXT1.PARAGRAPH_2: Once created, it takes approximately four to six weeks for the fistula to be used.
TEXT1.PARAGRAPH_3: Patients should perform exercises with the arm in which the fistula was created to accelerate maturation. In general, exercises such as squeezing a rubber ball are recommended.
TEXT1.PARAGRAPH_4: After removal of the fistula needles, moderate compression should be performed for approximately 10 to 20 minutes.
TEXT1.PARAGRAPH_5: Watch out: If the arm of the fistula shows changes in skin color, pain, tingling, loss of sensation, increased temperature, and lesions or blisters, the attending nurse or doctor must be warned.
TEXT1.PARAGRAPH_6: Avoid carrying heavy purses and bags with the arm of the fistula and sleeping on top of it, as it may cause decreased blood flow.
TEXT1.PARAGRAPH_7: It is forbidden to check out the blood pressure in the arm of the fistula.
TEXT1.PARAGRAPH_8: It is not advisable to receive injections or have blood drawn from the arm of the fistula.

ALERT.TITLE: Sources
ALERT.MESSAGE: DAUGIRDAS, J. T.; BLAKE, P. G.; ING,T. 8. Manual da Diálise. 4 ed. Rio de Janeiro:Guanabara Koogan, 2008.

AZATIOPRINA.TITLE: What is Azathioprine?
AZATIOPRINA.TEXT1: Azathioprine belongs to a class of drugs called immunosuppressants. It is used to help the body accept the transplanted organ and also to treat rheumatoid arthritis.

TEXT2.PARAGRAPH_2: Decrease in white, red and platelet blood cells

FAQ.TITLE: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.LABEL1: How do I know if my kidneys are ok? What examinations should I undergo?
FAQ.ACCORDION1: Pay attention to the color and aspect of your urine. In general, it should be “golden yellow”. Reddish or foamy urine can be a sign of kidney problems.
FAQ.ACCORDION2: If you have pain or difficulty urinating, see a doctor.
FAQ.ACCORDION3: Watch out for how much urine you produce and how often,
FAQ.ACCORDION4: Presence of swelling (edema) in the face or legs may be signs of kidney problems.
FAQ.ACCORDION5: At least once a year, ask your doctor to order a urine test and blood creatinine measurement.
FAQ.LABEL2: I received my routine tests, which showed increased levels of urea and/or creatinine. Do I need to undergo hemodialysis?
FAQ.LABEL3: Your test results must be seen by a doctor, who will give you instructions on what should be done. In general, changes in kidney function have many causes, and it will be up to your doctor to advise you in the best way.
FAQ.LABEL4: Who is most at risk for developing CKD?
FAQ.ITEN2: Family members of individuals with kidney disease
FAQ.LABEL5: Even if you do not belong to these groups, do not neglect your health and have regular checkups.
FAQ.LABEL6: How to prevent the onset of CKD?
FAQ.ITEN5: Adequate control of blood pressure, blood sugar ("blood sugar") and body weight
FAQ.ITEN9: Correct use of medications prescribed by your doctor
FAQ.ITEN13: Do not take anti-inflammatory medication and any other medication without a doctor's advice
FAQ.LABEL7: These are some of the actions that help prevent not only the onset of CKD, but also of other diseases.

GRAFT.TITLE: Maintaining vascular access
GRAFT.LABEL2: • Care is similar to that of the arteriovenous fistula, but PTFE has a shorter maturation period, usually 2 or 3 weeks.

HYPERTENSION.LABEL1: Hypertension control is critical to reducing the risk of cardiovascular disease in the medium and long term.
HYPERTENSION.LABEL2: Important measures to keep pressure under control:
HYPERTENSION.ITEN1: Reduce the consumption of salty foods
HYPERTENSION.ITEN2: Avoid drinking too much liquid (water, juices, teas, coffee, etc.)

INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.TITLE: Symptoms
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL3: One cause is fluid removal (ultrafiltration) during treatment.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL4: How to prevent it: decrease the consumption of very salty foods, do not gain much weight between sessions, do not eat immediately before or during hemodialysis.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL6: Main causes: hypotension, patient below dry weight and high velocity in fluid withdrawal.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL7: How to prevent it: do not gain too much weight between hemodialysis sessions.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL9: They can have many causes, but the main one is hypotension.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL10: How to prevent it: the main preventive measure is to avoid episodes of hypotension
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL12: Its causes are generally unknown. In patients who drink coffee, the headache may be a manifestation of caffeine abstinence because its concentration in blood is reduced during hemodialysis.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL13: Talk to the health professionals in charge of your follow-up.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL15: These could be signs of infection related to vascular access, to the dialysis system itself or other factors.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL16: If you have these symptoms at home, let the team know before you start the hemodialysis, so you can be evaluated. If they occur during the session, the team will perform your treatment.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL18: It can be a manifestation of slight hypersensitivity to the dialyzer (capillary) or bloodline components, or even to Heparin.
INTERCURREN_HEMODIALYSIS.LABEL19: Talk to the health professionals in charge of your follow-up.

ALERT2.TITLE: Fluid controls
ALERT2.MESSAGE: As in CKD the kidneys cannot eliminate all the fluid you have ingested through your urine, it is common for the excess to accumulate in your body, which can cause swelling, increased blood pressure and even acute lung edema (excess fluid in the lung).

MEDICATIONS.TITLE: Medications
MEDICATIONS.TOAST_MESSAGE_ERROR: An internal error has occurred. Please try again later

MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.TITLE: Recommendations about medication
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN1: Take your medications as prescribed by your doctor. Follow the schedule and doses prescribed by your doctor.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN2: Do not discontinue the treatment with your medications without first consulting your doctor or the health team in charge of your follow-up.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN3: Keep your medications stored out of the reach of children. Store them away from heat and direct light in a cool, dry place. Do not store expired medications (return them to the hospital)
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN4: At each consultation, your attending physician will evaluate your blood tests and make any necessary adjustments to your medication. Report any negative effects related to the use of your medications.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN5: If you forget to take some medication, take it as soon as you remember if it is still on the same day. Never take a double dose. If you miss your dose, note this down and tell your doctor at the next consultation.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN6: Never take any medication that has not been prescribed by the doctor.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN7: Always carry your last prescription with you.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN8: Always keep medications in their original packaging.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN9: Learn the names of medications and know what they are for.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN10: Do not exchange medication boxes or mix them up with others.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN11: If unexpected effects such as vomiting, urticaria, headache, stomach pain occur, report them immediately to the doctor.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN12: If a doctor who is not a member of you follow-up team prescribes medication and you are unsure if you can take it, contact the transplant team.
MEDICATIONS_RECOMMENDATIONS.ITEN13: Do not take immunosuppressants before having blood collected for laboratory tests and remember to take them after the collection.

MEDIUM_QUANTITY_PHOSPHORUS_FOOD.LABEL1: Food with small and medium content of phosphorus:

QUESTION.TITLE: Questionnaire
QUESTION.LABEL3: Answer the questions in this test and find out if you have any major risk factors for chronic kidney disease.

QUIZ.1: 2- I am between 60 and 69 years old
QUIZ.7: 8- I had a heart attack (infarction) or stroke
QUIZ.8: 9- I have congestive heart failure or heart failure
QUIZ.9: 10- I have circulatory problem/circulatory disease in my legs
QUIZ.10: 11- My test showed that I have protein loss in my urine

RESULT._1: You probably don't have kidney disease right now, but at least once a year you should take this test.
RESULT._2:
You have a 1 in 5 chance of having chronic kidney disease.

On the next appointment with a doctor, a simple blood test should be ordered. Only a healthcare professional can determine with certainty if you have kidney disease.

SELECT_TREATMENT.TITLE: Select treatment
SELECT_TREATMENT.LABEL2: What type of treatment are you undergoing?

SERVICE_TERM.TITLE: Terms of Use for the Application
SERVICE_TERM.LABEL1: Renal Health is an application developed by a team of health researchers at the University of Fortaleza to inform the population about chronic kidney disease (CKD) and help the patients undergoing treatment to follow the guidelines and to better understand the disease.
SERVICE_TERM.LABEL2: Some data that are entered into the app will be collected by researchers to be studied in the academic context, aiming to evaluate the application performance and whether its use is associated with a decreased number of treatment adverse episodes and CKD complications.
SERVICE_TERM.LABEL3: The identity of users is kept confidential, meaning their participation is anonymous and their personal data will not be disclosed.
SERVICE_TERM.LABEL4: It is important to remember that even when using the Renal Health app, the patient must follow the recommendations of the health professionals in charge of their follow-up. Moreover, the effectiveness of the Renal Health app depends on the correct entry of patient data and their adherence to the guidelines.
SERVICE_TERM.LABEL5: If you have any questions, please contact the Renal Health Project coordinators:
SERVICE_TERM.LABEL10: Universidade de Fortaleza Endereço: Avenida Washington Soares, 1321, Fortaleza-Ceará. Telefone: (85) 3477 3280
SERVICE_TERM.LABEL11: By accepting this Terms of Use you will have access to all functionalities of the Renal Health application, which will allow your data to be collected anonymously by the researchers.

SHORT_STAY_CATHETER.TITLE: Maintaining vascular access
SHORT_STAY_CATHETER.ITEN1: During catheter handling the dialysis staff and the patient should wear masks.
SHORT_STAY_CATHETER.ITEN2: The catheter lumen and tips should never be exposed to the environment.
SHORT_STAY_CATHETER.ITEN3: The catheter dressings should be kept dry at all times and should only be changed by healthcare professionals trained for changing sterile dressings. Patients should avoid from any contact of the dressing with water, as wet dressings may favor the onset of infections.

ALERT.TITLE: Sources
ALERT.MESSAGE: DAUGIRDAS, J. T.; BLAKE, P. G.; ING,T. S. Manual da Diálise.4 ed. Rio de Janeiro:Guanabara Koogan, 2008.

SIGNAL_AND_SYMPTONS.TITLE: Signals and symptoms
SIGNAL_AND_SYMPTONS.LABEL1: If you notice any of these signs and symptoms, immediately go to the transplant service in charge of your follow-up.
SIGNAL_AND_SYMPTONS.ITEN1: Pain or swelling at the surgical site
SIGNAL_AND_SYMPTONS.ITEN4: High weight gain in a short time
SIGNAL_AND_SYMPTONS.ITEN5: Swelling (edema) of the eyelids, hands or feet
SIGNAL_AND_SYMPTONS.ITEN8: Increase in blood pressure with minimum value >100 mmHg

SIROLIMO.TITLE: Sirolimus  (Rapamune®) 1 mg
SIROLIMO.LABEL2: Sirolimus is an immunosuppressant (a medication that inhibits the immune system) indicated for preventing organ rejection in kidney transplant recipients.
SIROLIMO.LABEL4: Seek medical attention immediately if any of the previous adverse reactions occur.
SIROLIMO.LABEL5: WARNING: The full list of adverse reactions can be found in the medication package insert.
SIROLIMO.ITEN5: Decreased white and red cells and platelets in the blood
SIROLIMO.ITEN10: Loss of protein in the urine

ALERT.MESSAGE1: Watch out for any adverse reactions and contact the hospital where you are being followed-up

TACROLIMO.TITLE: Tacrolimus 1 mg and 5 mg
TACROLIMO.LABEL2: Tacrolimus is recommended after you have a kidney or liver transplant to prevent your immune system from rejecting the transplanted organ.
TACROLIMO.LABEL4: Tacrolimus capsules should be taken with liquid (preferably water) and on an empty stomach or at least 1 hour before meals or 2 to 3 hours after meals to achieve maximum drug absorption.
TACROLIMO.LABEL5: WARNING: The full list of adverse reactions can be found in the medication package insert.

ALERT.MESSAGE1: Watch out for any adverse reactions and contact the hospital where you are being followed-up

TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.TITLE: Questions
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL2: The body has a very complex system (immune system) that reacts against foreign organs. As the transplanted kidney is recognized as " foreign ", the body will react against it and try to destroy it, unless it is given medication to decrease this reaction. Such medications are called immunosuppressants.
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL4: It is the body's reaction to the new kidney. Some degree of rejection is expected; some patients will experience rejection during the first or second week after transplantation. There are several ways to treat rejection and most often it is resolved.
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL5: How can one know if rejection is occurring?
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL6: The nephrologist performs the assessment of the occurrence or not of the rejection process. However, some signs and symptoms should be observed, such as:
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.ITEN1: Pain or swelling under the transplanted kidney.
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.ITEN6: Loss of the sense of well-being, among others.
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL7: Is there any need for fluid restriction after transplantation?
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL8: Most patients are able to drink as much fluid as they want after the transplantation. However, if the blood pressure is high and fluid retention (edema) occurs, the patient may be advised to restrict fluid and salt intake.
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL9: Is there any need for food restriction after the transplantation?
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL10: Because each individual is unique, nutritional recommendations may vary. However, there are some dietary restrictions related to medications and results of the latest tests.
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL11: Is it possible to have a normal life with only one kidney?
TRANSPLANT_DOUBTS.LABEL12: A kidney can do the work of two and a person's life will be normal, both in their personal and professional activities.

TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.TITLE: Overall
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN1: To prevent infections, some doctors will advise the use of protective masks in the early days.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN2: Limit visits to a few relatives and friends at first.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN3: Keep away from persons with transmissible diseases or animals.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN4: Keep the house always clean and airy, especially the bathrooms.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN5: Wash your hands with soap and water before and after using the bathroom, eating or getting home.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN6: Control your blood pressure, pulse, temperature and weight, annotating the values daily for your doctor's knowledge. In case of alterations, report them immediately to your doctor.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN7: Create a Diary of ingested fluids and eliminated urine, as it is vitally important to control the progress of the transplant.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN8: Always use a high-factor sunscreen when you leave the house; as well as caps, hats and clothing that protect you from the sun.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN9: Do not, under any circumstances, discontinue the immunosuppressive medication.
TRANSPLANTED_GERAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN10: Never take medications without a prescription.

TRANSPLANTED_NUTRITIONAL_RECOMMENDATION.TITLE: Nutritional
TRANSPLANTED_NUTRITIONAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN1: Cook the food just before eating and never reheat the food.
TRANSPLANTED_NUTRITIONAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN2: Store food in a refrigerator for a period of 24 hours only.
TRANSPLANTED_NUTRITIONAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN3: Beverages, when capped, remain sterile (in plastic or glass bottles). Once opened, they can only be kept fit for consumption for 4 hours at room temperature or for 24 hours in the refrigerator. The same is true for canned products.
TRANSPLANTED_NUTRITIONAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN4: When eating in restaurants, be sure to check the origin of the food and make sure it is fresh and of good quality.
TRANSPLANTED_NUTRITIONAL_RECOMMENDATION.ITEN5: Strictly follow the diet indicated for you and do not consume foods prepared in unfamiliar places.

TRANSPLANTED_WEIGHT.TITLE: Weight
TRANSPLANTED_WEIGHT.LABEL3: You haven't recorded your weight yet

WEIGHT.TEXT1: Last calculated weight with dry weight of

TREATMENT_DRC.TITLE: Chronic kidney disease
TREATMENT_DRC.LABEL1: What is the treatment of CKD?
TREATMENT_DRC.LABEL3: Indicated for patients with stage 1 to 4 kidney disease. It is performed during periodic medical appointments and consists of all clinical measures (medication prescription, changes in diet and lifestyle) that can be used to delay worsening of renal function, reduce symptoms and prevent complications associated with chronic kidney disease.
TREATMENT_DRC.LABEL4: The sooner the conservative treatment begins, the greater the chances of preserving kidney function.
TREATMENT_DRC.LABEL6: Indicated for patients who have stage 5 kidney disease. A membrane from the patient's own body, the peritoneum, which surrounds the abdominal organs, is used for blood filtration. The space between these organs is called the peritoneal cavity. A dialysis fluid is introduced into this cavity and removed through a catheter placed in the patient's belly. It can be performed in clinics or at home.
TREATMENT_DRC.LABEL8: Indicated for patients who have stage 5 kidney disease. It is a procedure in which a machine cleans and filtrates the blood through a dialyzer. Blood is withdrawn and returned to the patient's body through an arteriovenous fistula (AVF) or catheter. In general, hemodialysis sessions are performed 3 times a week for 4 hours in specialized clinics or hospitals.
TREATMENT_DRC.LABEL10: It is performed through surgery in which a healthy kidney, donated by a living or deceased person, is transplanted to a patient with stage 5 kidney disease and this healthy kidney performs functions that the diseased kidneys no longer can.
TREATMENT_DRC.LABEL11: Remember: The choice of treatment modality is individualized for each patient and will depend on careful consideration of several clinical and social aspects. Talk to your doctor.

ALERT.TITLE: Do you want to delete this test?
Do you want to delete this test?
ALERT.MESSAGE1: Excessive weight gain between hemodialysis sessions increases the risk of hypotension, cramps, nausea, headache and acute lung edema.
ALERT.MESSAGE2: Source: RIELLA, M.C.; MARTINS, C.Nutrição e o rim. 2. ed. Rio de Janeiro: Guanabara Koogan, 2013.

RESULT._1: High weight gain between hemodialysis sessions
RESULT._2: You are within the expected weight gain range

WHAT_IS_DRC.TITLE: Chronic kidney disease
WHAT_IS_DRC.LABEL2: It is a disease in which the kidneys show abnormalities in their function or structure for more than 3 months, with damage to your health. In general, the kidneys lose their function slowly and without symptoms.
WHAT_IS_DRC.LABEL3: CKD is divided into 5 phases based on Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR):
WHAT_IS_DRC.LABEL5: The kidneys still work well, but there is already some sign of injury, such as protein in the urine.
WHAT_IS_DRC.LABEL7: The kidneys show a slight decrease in their function. As in stage 1, it is important to have a diagnosis of CKD, as it is possible to prevent the next stages with adequate treatment.
WHAT_IS_DRC.LABEL9: The kidneys have moderately lost their efficiency and are already beginning to show the first signs of disease. If you haven’t started yet, this is the time to start treatment with a nephrologist.
WHAT_IS_DRC.LABEL11: Kidney function is already severely impaired and requires more attention and care.
WHAT_IS_DRC.LABEL13: The kidneys no longer function. That's when renal replacement therapy (dialysis or kidney transplantation) should start.
WHAT_IS_DRC.LABEL14: With Renal Health, you can calculate your GFR if you have a creatinine measurement result from your blood test.

ALERT.TITLE: Sources
ALERT.MESSAGE: KDIGO 2012 Clinical Practice Guidelinefor the Evaluation and Management of Chronic Kidney Disease (www.kdigo.org)

WHAT_ISKIDNEYS.TITLE: About the kidneys
WHAT_ISKIDNEYS.LABEL2: The kidneys are two bean-shaped organs measuring 10 to 13 cm in an adult. They are located on both sides of the spine, approximately in the middle of the back.
WHAT_ISKIDNEYS.LABEL3: The kidneys are considered as the body's filtration system. It can be said that they filtrate all of a person's blood approximately 12 times an hour.

WHAT_MAIN_FUNCTION_KIDNEY.TITLE: About the kidneys
WHAT_MAIN_FUNCTION_KIDNEY.LABEL1: What are the main functions of the kidneys?
WHAT_MAIN_FUNCTION_KIDNEY.LABEL2: To remove waste that is produced from food degradation and normal muscle activity, such as urea and creatinine
WHAT_MAIN_FUNCTION_KIDNEY.LABEL3: To regulate the amount of water in your body and other substances in your blood, such as sodium, potassium, phosphorus and calcium
WHAT_MAIN_FUNCTION_KIDNEY.LABEL4: To remove drugs and toxins introduced into your body
WHAT_MAIN_FUNCTION_KIDNEY.LABEL5: To release hormones into your blood to help regulate blood pressure, produce red blood cells and promote strong bones
